Class RocketshipBoard

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.playerset.RocketshipBoard
public class RocketshipBoard extends Object
RocketshipBoard's class represents each player's personal rocketship board

    addComponent() places the component on the board at the designated cell.

    method that adds the cubes received from a card to a player's rocketship.

    Hand represents the situation when the players draw a component from the heap.

    checkMaxThrustPower() checks the thrust power that would be in effect in case all batteries were to be used.
    boolean
    checkShipAtStart()
    checkShipAtStart() checks that every component is linked up correctly, that the rules are respected, that the ship is integrous (no connected components) and that there are not more instances of the same component
    boolean
    checkShipEverytime()
    checkShipEverytime() checks if the ship is integer (no connected components) and if there's more than one instance of the same component

    checkSingleCannonsFirePower() checks the firepower conferred by the single thrusters alone

    checkSingleThrustersThrustPower() checks the thrust power conferred by the single thrusters alone

    checkTotalBatteries() returns the number of the batteries on the board (of course not considering the ones used to power up a double component)
    int
    checkTotalCrew()
    checkTotalCrew() at first generates a list containing all the cabins (both starting and simple) and then calculates the number of residents for each one
    void
    chooseBrokenShip(int choice)
    chooseBrokenShip() receives an int representing which of the connected parts of the ship the user wants to save and proceeds to remove all the components that belong to other part(s)

    countExposedConnectors() checks, for every card in the board, how many exposed connectors it has.

    fixDisconnectedRocketship() is useful to fix the ship of a user that disconnected himself during takeoff phase

  • Constructor Details

    • RocketshipBoard

      public RocketshipBoard(FlightType flightType, PlayerColor color)

  • Method Details

    • addHand

      public void addHand(Component newC)
      Hand represents the situation when the players draw a component from the heap. addHand() takes the component and places it into player's hand. If the player has a valid component in hand the method throws an exception

    • removeHand

      public void removeHand()
      removeHand() simply discard the component card that the player's holding in his hand. The method throws an exception if the player has in hand an empty component

    • getHandComponent

      public Component getHandComponent()
      getHandComponent() returns the component that the player's holding in his hand. If the player's got no component the method throws an exception

    • rotateHand

      public void rotateHand()
      rotateHand() gets the component in hand and proceeds to turn it clockwise one time. Throws an exception if

    • putHandInReserved

      public void putHandInReserved()
      putHandInReserved() takes the hand component and puts in the reserve. If there are already two reserved components it throws a RuntimeException

    • getReservedComponent

      public void getReservedComponent(int choice)
      getReservedComponent() allows the user to put in his hand one of the two reserved components. If the hand is already full an exception is thrown
      Parameters:
      choice - must be 1 or 2, indicating which component needs to be taken

    • getReservedComponentType

      public ComponentType getReservedComponentType(int choice)
      getReservedComponentType() returns the type of the requested reserved component
      Parameters:
      choice - indicates which of the two reserved component we are considering

    • returnReservedComponents

      public Component[] returnReservedComponents()
      returnReservedComponents() simply returns the two reserved components

    • isCellValid

      public boolean isCellValid(int row, int col)
      isCellValid() determines whether a certain cell is part of the board or not (because boards are not rectangles or squares)
      Parameters:
      row - is the row number of the cell
      col - is the column number of the cell
      Returns:
      true if the cell is part of the board, false if that cell is not valid

    • isCellFree

      public boolean isCellFree(int row, int col)
      isCellFree() determines whether a certain valid cell is free or not
      Parameters:
      row - is the row number of the cell
      col - is the column number of the cell
      Returns:
      true if the cell is valid and is free, false in any other case

    • isCellBuildable

      public boolean isCellBuildable(int row, int col)
      isCellBuildable() check if a certain cell is valid and buildable (to be buildable a cell has to have a component adjacent to it)
      Parameters:
      row - is the row number of the cell
      col - is the column number of the cell
      Returns:
      true if the cell is buildable, false in any other case

    • getComponentAt

      public Component getComponentAt(int row, int col)
      getComponentAt() simply returns the component card at the requested cell without removing it from the board
      Parameters:
      row - is the row number of the cell
      col - is the column number of the cell
      Returns:
      the component if the cell is valid and has a component on it, returns an empty component if the cell is empty or not valid. Throws an exception if the cell does not physically exists

    • getWholeShip

      public Component[][] getWholeShip()
      getWholeShip() returns a matrix containing a copy of the board
      Returns:
      a double array containing all the components of the ship, even the empty ones. The component at the position (i,j) will be found at result[i][j]

    • getBuildableCells

      public boolean[][] getBuildableCells()
      getBuildableCells() is useful to determine where the player can place a component. If a cell is valid and free and buildable (at least one component next to it) then a component can be placed on it
      Returns:
      a matrix of booleans. If the cell at the position (i,j) is buildable then result[i][j] is true, otherwise is false

    • getRowOrColumn

      public List<Component> getRowOrColumn(int rc, ComponentSide side)
      getRowOrColumn() returns either an entire column or an entire row, depending on the specified side
      Parameters:
      rc - is the number of row/column we want to get
      side - represents from which side we want to take the row/column
      Returns:
      a List containing all the components of row or column

    • addComponent

      public void addComponent(int row, int col, Component c)
      addComponent() places the component on the board at the designated cell. It throws an exception if the cell is not buildable or not free
      Parameters:
      row - is the row number of the cell
      col - is the column number of the cell
      c - is the component itself

    • removeComponent

      public void removeComponent(int row, int col)
      removeComponent() ensures that the cell is valid, taken by an actual component (different from the start cabin). If these conditions are granted it removes the component. Otherwise, it throws an exception. The removed component will be added to destroyed component's list
      Parameters:
      row - is the row number of the cell we want to remove
      col - is the column number of the cell we want to remove

    • countComponentsDestroyedDuringFlight

      public int countComponentsDestroyedDuringFlight()

    • getCoordinates

      public int[] getCoordinates(Component c)
      getCoordinates() return an array of two int containing the coordinates of the component if present, otherwise throws an exception
      Parameters:
      c - is the component which coordinates we want to get
      Returns:
      an array of two int, first element is the row number, second element is the column number

    • getComponentByType

      public List<Component> getComponentByType(ComponentType type)
      getComponentByType() returns a list containing all the component on the board of a specified type
      Parameters:
      type - is the type of components we want to create a list with
      Returns:
      a list with all the components of that type

    • getAdjacentComponents

      public List<Component> getAdjacentComponents(Component component)
      getAdjacentComponents() returns a list containing all the components on the board adjacent to the specified one
      Parameters:
      component - is the component of which we want to know adjacent ones
      Returns:
      a list containing all the adjacent components

    • getAdjacentComponent

      public Component getAdjacentComponent(Component component, ComponentSide side)
      getAdjacentComponent() returns the component adjacent to the specified one on the specified side
      Parameters:
      component - is the component of which we want to know the adjacent one on that side

    • getAdjacentComponentsAndSides

      public Map<Component,ComponentSide> getAdjacentComponentsAndSides(Component component)
      getAdjacentComponentsAndSides() returns a map containing all the components on the board adjacent to the specified one paired to their side of connection
      Parameters:
      component - is the component of which we want to know the adjacent ones and their side with respect to the connection
      Returns:
      a mapo containing each adiacent component and his position in respect to the central component

    • getConnectedComponents

      public List<Component> getConnectedComponents(Component component)
      getConnectedComponents() simply returns a list of all the components adjacent and connected on the board to the specified one. If an adjacent component is not properly connected to the central one it will not be included in the list
      Parameters:
      component - is the component of which we want to know adjacent and connected ones
      Returns:
      a list with all the adjacent and connected components

    • getAdjacentConnector

      public ConnectorType getAdjacentConnector(Component c, ComponentSide side)
      getAdjacentConnector returns the connector immediately adjacent to the specified side of the specified component. If the adjacent cell is empty or not valid the connector returned will be an empty space.
      Returns:
      the connector of the adjacent component in the specified direction
      Throws:
      Exception - if the specified component is not on the board

    • countExposedConnectors

      public int countExposedConnectors()
      countExposedConnectors() checks, for every card in the board, how many exposed connectors it has. If the card next to the one is placed increases the count if the checked card has a connector and the other one has a smooth side. If the card next to the one is empty, or it is not a valid position, the count is increased if the card has a connector on that side
      Returns:
      an int representing the number of exposed connectors

    • checkTotalCrew

      public int checkTotalCrew()
      checkTotalCrew() at first generates a list containing all the cabins (both starting and simple) and then calculates the number of residents for each one
      Returns:
      an int representing the total number of crew member on the board

    • hasSingleThrusters

      public boolean hasSingleThrusters()
      hasSingleThrusters() checks whether the player has at least one single thruster component on their rocketship
      Returns:
      true if the player has at least a single thruster, false otherwise

    • hasDoubleThrusters

      public boolean hasDoubleThrusters()
      hasSingleThrusters() checks whether the player has at least one double thruster component on their rocketship
      Returns:
      true if the player has at least a double thruster, false otherwise

    • hasSingleCannons

      public boolean hasSingleCannons()
      hasSingleThrusters() checks whether the player has at least one single cannon component on their rocketship
      Returns:
      true if the player has at least a single cannon, false otherwise

    • hasDoubleCannons

      public boolean hasDoubleCannons()
      hasSingleThrusters() checks whether the player has at least one double cannon component on their rocketship
      Returns:
      true if the player has at least a double cannon, false otherwise

    • hasBatteries

      public boolean hasBatteries()
      hasSingleThrusters() checks whether the player has at least one battery on their rocketship
      Returns:
      true if the player has at least a battery, false otherwise

    • checkTotalBatteries

      public int checkTotalBatteries()
      checkTotalBatteries() returns the number of the batteries on the board (of course not considering the ones used to power up a double component)

    • hasShield

      public boolean hasShield(ComponentSide side)
      hasShield() checks if the ship has a shield (yet to be activated) on the specified side
      Parameters:
      side - is the side we want to know if it's covered
      Returns:
      true if a shield is able to defend that side, false otherwise

    • checkSingleCannonsFirePower

      public float checkSingleCannonsFirePower()
      checkSingleCannonsFirePower() checks the firepower conferred by the single thrusters alone
      Returns:
      the thrust power of single thrusters only

    • checkDefaultFirePower

      public float checkDefaultFirePower()
      checkDefaultFirePower() checks the firepower that would be in effect in case no battery were to be used
      Returns:
      firepower in case no battery were to be used

    • checkActivatableFirePower

      public float checkActivatableFirePower(int x)
      checkActivatableFirePower() checks the firepower that would be in effect in case x batteries were to be used. no battery is actually consumed
      Parameters:
      x - is the number of batteries that are used
      Returns:
      thrust power in case x batteries were to be used

    • checkMaxFirePower

      public float checkMaxFirePower()
      checkMaxFirePower() checks the firepower that would be in effect in case all batteries were to be used. no battery is actually consumed
      Returns:
      firepower in case all available batteries were to be used

    • checkAvailableDoubleCannons

      public int checkAvailableDoubleCannons()
      checkAvailableDoubleCannons() is used for counting the number of double cannons present on the rocketship
      Returns:
      the number of double cannons

    • hasPurpleAlien

      public boolean hasPurpleAlien()
      hasBrownAlien() checks if the rocketship is housing a purple alien
      Returns:
      true if present, false otherwise

    • checkSingleThrustersThrustPower

      public float checkSingleThrustersThrustPower()
      checkSingleThrustersThrustPower() checks the thrust power conferred by the single thrusters alone
      Returns:
      the thrust power of single thrusters only

    • checkDefaultThrustPower

      public float checkDefaultThrustPower()
      checkDefaultThrustPower() checks the thrust power that would be in effect in case no battery were to be used
      Returns:
      thrust power in case no battery were to be used

    • checkActivatableThrustPower

      public float checkActivatableThrustPower(int x)
      checkActivatableThrustPower() checks the thrust power that would be in effect in case x batteries were to be used. no battery is actually consumed
      Parameters:
      x - is the number of batteries that are used
      Returns:
      thrust power in case x batteries were to be used

    • checkMaxThrustPower

      public float checkMaxThrustPower()
      checkMaxThrustPower() checks the thrust power that would be in effect in case all batteries were to be used. no battery is actually consumed
      Returns:
      thrust power in case all available batteries were to be used

    • checkAvailableDoubleThrusters

      public int checkAvailableDoubleThrusters()
      checkAvailableDoubleThrusters() is used for counting the number of double thrusters present on the rocketship
      Returns:
      the number of double thrusters

    • hasBrownAlien

      public boolean hasBrownAlien()
      hasBrownAlien() checks if the rocketship is housing a brown alien
      Returns:
      true if present, false otherwise

    • removeCubeByPrice

      public void removeCubeByPrice()
      removeCubeByPrice() removes one cube of the most expensive type that is present of the ship

    • removeBatteries

      public void removeBatteries(int num) throws Exception
      removeBatteries() removes a specified number of batteries from the rocketship
      Parameters:
      num - indicates the number of batteries to remove
      Throws:
      Exception

    • removeCrewmates

      public void removeCrewmates(int num)
      removeCrewmates() removes a specified number of crew members from the rocketship
      Parameters:
      num - indicates the number of players to remove

    • smuggle

      public void smuggle(int penalty)
      smuggle() removes a number of cubes from the stock components of the rocketship, starting from the most valuable. this is in accordance with the smugglers adventure card, since it's the very method that is called by the card
      Parameters:
      penalty - indicates the number of cubes to remove

    • checkConnectors

      public boolean checkConnectors()
      checkConnectors() scans the whole ship to find if some components has non-matching connectors with the connectors next to it
      Returns:
      true if every component on the ship has matching (or exposed) connectors, false if there's a component with at least a non-matching side

    • resetSimpleCabinSupportedAtmospheres

      public void resetSimpleCabinSupportedAtmospheres()
      setSimpleCabinSupportedAtmospheres() is in charge of updating, for each simple cabin, which color of alien is currently accepted

    • checkIntegrity

      public List<HashSet<Component>> checkIntegrity()
      checkIntegrity() scans the whole ship to determine if there are parts of it not connected to the others.
      Returns:
      a list that contains the subgroups of connected components. For example, if there are three groups of components without link to each other this method returns a list with the three sets of components. The ship is integrous if the size of the returned list is one, otherwise not every component is connected to any other one

    • prioritizeStartingCabinGroup

      public void prioritizeStartingCabinGroup(List<HashSet<Component>> componentsGroupings)
      prioritizeStartingCabinGroup() sorts the subgraphs of components by simply moving the subgraph that contains the starting cabin to the first position in the list. the reason behind this is to have the automatic removal of all but one subgroups make more sense in case a player is disconnected
      Parameters:
      componentsGroupings -

    • checkShipAtStart

      public boolean checkShipAtStart()
      checkShipAtStart() checks that every component is linked up correctly, that the rules are respected, that the ship is integrous (no connected components) and that there are not more instances of the same component
      Returns:
      true if the ship is compliant with the rules, false otherwise

    • checkShipEverytime

      public boolean checkShipEverytime()
      checkShipEverytime() checks if the ship is integer (no connected components) and if there's more than one instance of the same component
      Returns:
      true if the ship is compliant with the rules, false otherwise

    • fixDisconnectedPlayersRocketship

      public void fixDisconnectedPlayersRocketship()
      fixDisconnectedRocketship() is useful to fix the ship of a user that disconnected himself during takeoff phase

    • getSizeOfSetOfConnectedComponents

      public int getSizeOfSetOfConnectedComponents()
      getNumberOfConnectedComponents() returns the total number of parts in which the ship is broken into

    • getPossibleAlienOptions

      public List<Map<Component,Integer>> getPossibleAlienOptions()
      getPossibleAlienOptions() returns for every component which type of crew it can get
      Returns:
      a List containing all the simple cabin and an integer. 0 if the cabin can store humans, 1 purple, 2 brown, 3 purple or brown

    • putBatteriesAndCrew

      public void putBatteriesAndCrew()
      putBatteriesAndCrew() is in charge of putting on the ship batteries and human crew on the starting cabin

    • putAlienCrew

      public int putAlienCrew(int row, int col, CrewType type)
      putAlienCrew() puts a crew member of the specified type on the selected component
      Returns:
      an int representing which category of crew has been added. 0 for humans, 1 for purple, 2 for brown

    • chooseBrokenShip

      public void chooseBrokenShip(int choice)
      chooseBrokenShip() receives an int representing which of the connected parts of the ship the user wants to save and proceeds to remove all the components that belong to other part(s)
      Parameters:
      choice - represent which part of the ship is saved by user. The parameter must be between 0 and the number of connected parts

    • addCubes

      public void addCubes(CubeToken[] cubes) throws Exception
      method that adds the cubes received from a card to a player's rocketship. If there isn't enough space for a cube, it throws away the less precious ones
      Parameters:
      cubes - array of cubes the program will have to go through
      Throws:
      Exception

    • getLimitComponent

      public Component getLimitComponent(int rc, ComponentSide side)
      getLimitComponent() gets the first component that is encountered in a specific line, crossing the rocketship and starting from the edge
      Parameters:
      rc - is the int that specifies the row or column where the limit component has to be taken from
      side - specifies the side of the rocketship from which the limit component has to be taken from
      Returns:
      returns a reference to the component to remove from the rocketship

    • getValueOfCubes

      public int getValueOfCubes()
      getValueOfCubes() scans the whole ship counting all the cubes and their associated value
      Returns:
      the sum of all the values of the cubes in the ship
